text: They say swans sing right before they die. A man saw a swan for sale, and having heard that it was a very melodious animal, he bought it. One day the man was having dinner, and he brought the swan and begged him to sing during the feast. But the swan kept quiet. But one day, thinking the swan was about to die, he must have cried his melody beforehand. When the owner heard it, he said, "If you only sing when you die, I was a fool begging you to sing instead of sacrifice yourself". Sometimes we force what we don't want to do to the good.
title: El cisne y su dueño
author: nan Esopo
